logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html/ref=cm_ciu_vr_mo1MQ0XGFMLNQTR/178-0248111-8317679?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1MQ0XGFMLNQTRcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1MQ0XGFMLNQTRcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:38 MinsThere is a widespread and annoying issue with the touchscreens on these tablets where large portions of the screen are not responsive when you place the tablet on certain surfaces (demonstrated in video). I had this issue with my tablet and sent it for repair only to have it returned by HP with a note saying "NO DEFECT FOUND"[sic], despite the fact that the repair engineer called me and told me he was able to see the issue. I don't know if that is indicative of a screw up in the repair process or whether this is an issue that HP knows about and is choosing to ignore. After complaining about the issue HP offered a replacement which they sent to me a week late after being told it would only take 3 days. The replacement has the exact same issue. A quick search on google for "HP Envy X2 grounding issue" will show a youtube video where you can see a demonstration and a thread on HP's support forum where a number of customers are experiencing the same issue.

Reviews.Title: Great notepad/laptop in one. Win8 not great but promising.
Reviews.Author: I Yoo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a convertible laptop running Win8 because I wanted the convenience of a tablet and the versatility to run my Windows applications with a keyboard. I settled on HP Envy x2 and am pretty happy with the choice. I ruled out Surface Pro because it was too expensive (with the keyboard). Thinkpad twist was a serious contender but after checking out Dell XPS with a similar profile, I ruled it out because it was too bulky. When detached, Envy x2 weighs no more than my iPad and has larger display size, which nicely complements Win8's ability to run an app on the side bar. Like another reviewer here, I also read that the keyboard might be of concern but it seems to work just fine. One thing to note is that the storage is more in line with what you'd find in a high-end tablet. Although it starts at 64GB, 10GB is reserved and another 10GB is taken up by Win8. I think if you go to HP directly, you can get an upgrade to 128GB. One minor issue that I have encountered with the hardware is that when in tablet mode and laying flat, once in awhile the touch screen seems to become unresponsive. Tilting it slightly seems to cure the problem.That's the hardware story. Win8 is another matter and the new OS takes some time getting adjusted to. It took some time adjusting all the tile layouts to be somewhat efficient to navigate but once I did that I actually like it when using in tablet mode. Another thing that is a bit annoying and getting used to is that the keyboard (in tablet mode) doesn't automatically popup when running Windows applications. Still, I think Win8 is a step in the right direction for Microsoft to support the touch screen devices. Now if they would only bring back the start button...A couple of updates:Signed up for SkyDrive so now I have 7GB of additional cloud storage. Not that I needed it but it makes file sharing easier.I noticed that when the notepad is detached and running low on battery, attaching it to the keyboard charges the notepad from the battery in the keyboard. It seems like an obvious thing to do but still a nice feature.Installed Office 2013 (~2 GB) and it seems to run ok (better than expected) in notepad mode. There is a toggle in Office 2013 to optimize the control layout for the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Look and feel of quality
Reviews.Author: Jeffery L Mueller
Reviews.Content: This is not the most powerful PC I have, not by a long stretch.  however, I don't need it to be, I have a larger unit for that.  This will be an excellent travel companion.  The portability offered with the excellent battery life, and the detachable touch screen are great.  It's great to have the ability to work on office applications with or without internet access as it is a PC, not just a tablet with a keyboard, or a web dependent device.  Fit and finish on this unit is excellent.  It feels good and solid.  I'm just starting to work with it, but so far I have noticed none of the keyboard, dock, or WIFI issues that others have mentioned on some of the reviews I've read.  Simple to set up, download the updates to windows and system drivers. So far I have nothing to be disappointed in with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Will get the job done, truly for professionals and businessmen
Reviews.Author: Tim Yenmor "Tim"
Reviews.Content: ***************Important Update 03/20/2013*********************HP has released a bios update that fixes the double space double letter insert bug when people are typing fast.  You should go to the HP driver page for this device and download this very important update.  Look for the file sp61143.  The bios version is f08.I'm impressed that HP actually went through and tracked down the root cause of this issue.  Now, all devices are fixed.***************Original Review************************I am writing this coming from the asus vivotab tf810c.  Before I go on, allow me to point out a few advantages the envy x2 has over the vivotab tf810c.(1) The envy knows when you have the docking station plugged in.  When you have the dock plugged in, when you want to type something the onscreen keyboard will not pop up.  When the docking station is not on, the onscreen keyboard will pop up.(2) The envy feels more comfortable in my hands when I'm holding the tablet portion only.  Slightly better design.(3) The envy has the same color throughout.  The vivotab and its dock are 2 different colors.(4) The envy's speakers are in  the front.  Yes, somehow hp managed to put  the speakers in the front.  The vivotab's speakers are e in the back.(5) When docked in notebook form, the envy feels like one piece.  Very very sturdy. The vivotab is kinda wobbly.(6) I got the envy for $557, including tax, brand new.  Got the vivotab used for $863.  Will be selling the vivotab soon.(7) The envy has a full size sdcard slot and a full size hdmi port.  The vivotab does  not.Other than these things, the 2 devices are pretty much the same in all other aspects.With that said, the envy x2 really is a nice piece of work by HP.  The entire machine in notebook form is very thin, very light, and very attractive looking.  With the exception of the glass face, all of this machine is made of brushed aluminum making it look very classy and very aesthetically pleasing.I am a field engineer that does surveying for a living.  The applications of this windows 8 machine is perfect for what  I do.  And I would wager that for most professionals out there regardless of what kind this tablet/laptop hybrid would serve their purpose just as well.Why do I say that despite this machine running on clover trail atom processor?  The answer is quite simple.  Think this to  yourself.  If you have to work using very resource  intensive programs like autocad, photoshop, or 3D modeling, would you want to sit there for hours working with an 11.6 inch screen?  I'm betting the answer is NO.  I wouldn't want to work on the data we collected in the fields with such a small screen.  That's what our i5 and i7 desktops with 22-24 inch screens are for.What this machine is designed to do is be your companion with your work time and off time.  The clover trail atom processor of the envy x2 has plenty power to run engineering calculation programs like hy-8 and excel.  And many of us in the professional world knows that often times we have to crank out a report of a quick survey and send them off to our clients.  This machine is more than capable of running full version of MS office 2010.  No lag at all.Another use I have for this machine is the camera.  Before when I needed to send documents to clients or colleagues, I have to go back to the office and use the scanner.  Nowadays, using mobile scanner app from the MS store, I could take pictures  of the document pages, quickly convert them into pdf files, and email them off using my phone's internet tether.Now, I don't doubt other  people's reports of spotty wifi connection.  But for me, the wifi has been nothing short of perfect.  Bluetooth works wonderfully well as well.Another advantage the envy gives is it's got a microsdcard slot and a full size sdcard slot.  I have a 64gb micro and a 64gb full sd card.  They add up to 128gb of expanded memory for me, which is plenty for what I want to use this machine for.  And when that's not enough, I also have a 128gb jump drive that  I can insert into either of the 2 usb ports.Overall, I'm pleased with this product by HP.  All softwares are running perfectly.  I have not noticed any lag from the envy x2.  The device feels incredibly solid.Even though I had nothing but good things to say about the vivotab, I hesitated to recommend it to some friends of mine simply because of the lack of an sdcard port and a few other quirks.But for the HP Envy X2, I would highly recommend it to people I know.  I have a very good friend who is a therapist.  It is time for her to get a new computer.  She called me up last night to ask what she should get, and I recommended her the envy x2.**************************************************************************First Edit (March 13, 2013) [Problem solved - read Second Edit below]********************************A commenter pointed out something that I hadn't noticed before.  There is a bug with the keyboard of  the envy x2.  If you type really fast, about 5% of the  time a duplicate letter would be inserted after a space.  So, if  I were to type really fast, the last sentence would look like the following.If you type e really fast, about 5% of the e time a duplicate letter r would be inserted after r a space.Most of the time, I type at a normal pace, about 30-40 WPM.  When I want to, I can type up to 70 WPM.  This is why I hadn't noticed this problem in the original review.  So, I've taken out a star and downgraded this review to 4 star instead of 5.It is still a very capable device.  Among professionals, the average typing speed is 38-40 WPM.  So, for most people this bug would not even show up.I will be calling HP to ask about this bug.  There's also some complaints already on the HP tech forum.  Hopefully, HP will come up with a fix eventually.**********************Second Edit (3/14/2013) Problem solved!**************************So, I just went out to Staples to replace my envy x2 because of the keyboard defect because I called yesterday and they told me they just got a new patch of stock in.  These are newer and were manufactured in 2013.  The other x2 was manufactured at the end of 2012.As soon as I got home with this new envy x2, I installed MS office and started typing like crazy.  In fact, I'm typing this review really really fast right now.  So far, no double spaces or double letters inserted.  They solved this issue in later models!Back to 5 stars!Further more, the new keyboard feels more satisfying to speed type.  Every stroke registers without a problem.  I am typing up to 70-80 WPM and everything registers with no double spaces or double letters.I can now fully recommend this product to everyone.**********************Update (6/27/2013) ***************************************The clover trail processor on this thing really is more powerful than most people think.  My i7 desktop died on me a few months ago and I've been procrastinating in getting another desktop.  I just accepted another job, and I won't start that job for a couple weeks.  So, I've been spending all my time updating my apps and writing new ones.Using visual studio express 2012, I started and finished an app and published it entirely with this machine.  I am in the process of writing another app right now using only the x2.  I just plug it into the 24 inch monitor at home and use it like a desktop.  Hopefully, I will be able to finish the  app to publish it by this weekend.The point is the people who are dissing the x2 saying the processor is not powerful enough, they don't really know what they are talking about.  I'm creating and publishing apps using only this device.  That should tell you how capable this machine really is.

Reviews.Title: Lovely machine with poor  ... no make that very poor Wi-Fi
Reviews.Author: Samuel J "iNetSynch"
Reviews.Content: Some back ground: over thirty years developing software and hardware, experience with Windows 8 on six computers including two Hp towers, Toshiba laptop and upgraded Acer W500 tablet. I tried the new Acer W510 and sent it back.The Envy X2 looks and feels lovely. The screen and keyboard are good. The fly in the ointment is an almost unusable Wi-Fi, keyboard docking errors and issues with the installed Windows 8 recovery option.After charging and updating, I closed the Envy went to another room and when I opened it I was greeted with a message to the effect the pad did not match the dock and wanted me to re-flash the dock (EC version of Pad and Dock do not match). Twice now I have had to re-flash the dock to use it with the tablet. It seems OK now but makes me very nervous.Wi-Fi is poor ... very poor and documented by others on the HP forum. In most locations, I get between 1/10 to 3/4 the download speed seen when using all other PCs. When next to my router I can get 80 - 90% the download speed reported by my Acer W500 Win 8 tablet. Web Pages load slower and it useless when in my bedroom. My Acer W500 and lowly Sumsung Chromebook have no issues with Wi-Fi in any room.I tried to Reset to factory install of Windows and got a message something close to `could not refresh sending error file to Microsoft.' I  was forced to re-install in safe mode using f11 during boot. This had no effect on Wi-Fi.Twice Windows updates have crashed with a blue screen of death. Poor Wi-Fi and the inability to reset to factory state without booting in safe mode are deal killers. Too bad ... the machine would be a keeper if the Wi-Fi were improved and issues with Windows recovery fixed.Check HP Envy forums or before buying.UPDATE:The HP Envy was returned. I believe the poor Wi-FI performance is traceable to design and may make it unacceptable to many customers.UPDATE 2:Notice that Amazon no longer sells the Envy 2. Perhaps the return rate is too high? We would never buy this product from a vendor not offering a liberal return policy.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Laptop/Tablet Hybrid
Reviews.Author: Dash Riprock
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hybrid of a laptop & tablet. For all the tech specs google reviews because there are many written and videos about this product. I love the construction of this "convertible laptop" because the outer shell is made from a bushed finished aluminum that resists finger prints and gives it a nice heft that makes it seem like it's a very sturdy/rugged piece of machinery. I am not a computer tech savvy wonk so google reviews on this product. I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Most frustrating computer to use
Reviews.Author: William Conser
Reviews.Content: I'll be brief.  Windows 8 is glitchy and doesn't work well.  The bottom portion of the laptop has to be disconnected and connected again for the mouse pad to work.  Mouse pad does not work well.  Sever lag issues.  Top heavy when open.

Reviews.Title: Useless
Reviews.Author: Gary Washer
Reviews.Content: Never in my life would I have believed that HP would have come to this. This pc is simply garbage, nothing more. Nothing on it works reliably. The touch pad comes and goes whenever it likes. Keep a real mouse handy at all times. As for the touchscreen, sometimes it takes one touch to activate something; other times it takes two, using the same app. Sometimes at startup the web camera is on even though I never use it. Battery life is hit and miss. Sometimes an app can run for many hours on one charge; sometimes the same app drains the battery in under an hour. Simply the worst pc I have ever owned, and I have owned many over the last 30 years. Avoid this one like the plague.

Reviews.Title: This computer does not turn on.
Reviews.Author: Marianne Brï¿½ll
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this computer in January 2012. About a month after receiving the unit I was unable to turn it on even after fully charging the unit and holding the Power button for several minutes. I sent it to HP customer service describing the issue. They sent it back to me within a week telling me they couldn't recreate the problem and nothing was wrong with the unit. They also told me I needed to hold down the power button for 3 seconds. Sure enough, it worked when I received it. This problem has now occurred three more times in the past 8 months, and each of those times I had to send the computer back to HP. They still have not fixed the computer and are not willing to replace the unit or refund the cost, even though after having had the computer for 9 months now I have probably been able to use if for less than half of the time. Not to mention that every time they send it back to me  I have to reset all the settings of the computer. Obviously they sold me a faulty unit, but are unwilling to do something about it .I am not sure how many times I have to send this computer back to HP until they fix it. Unfortunately I am not able to actually review the computer, since I have barely used it. This is definitely the last time I will ever purchase anything from HP.

Reviews.Title: It's definitely more of a tablet
Reviews.Author: A Marcelli
Reviews.Content: It's definitely more a tablet than a laptop, but that's okay with me because that is what I ordered it for. I already have a laptop that I'm happy with. I ordered this over an iPad because I thought I would like Windows 8 better. I definitely wish I could take that decision back, as Windows 8 has been nothing but a big disappointment. But I'm reviewing the Envy, not Windows 8.When I first got this the keyboard was dead. Wouldn't work so I couldn't complete the initial setup required. It was useless. Amazon was quick to replace though. So the next one I received worked great. Although I still have issued with getting the touch pad mouse to work, it's fixed by restarting the computer. It's a quick but annoying fix that I've learned to deal with. I don't use the mouse that much anyways.After I got over that, it is a great tablet device. Too slow for some heavier programs you can run on a laptop but a great tablet. Quick, responsive, bright, and a great battery life (with and without the keyboard attached)

Reviews.Title: Awesome 2nd laptop: AMAZING battery life, fantastic form factor
Reviews.Author: HST
Reviews.Content: I really, really like the HP Envy X2 as a second laptop/tablet option. The form factor is very cool, from the super sleek brushed aluminum case to the ability to detach the screen to use it as a standalone Windows tablet. As other reviews have noted, be sure to realize the Envy X2 purposefully isn't designed for CPU-intensive applications like Photoshop, 3D games, etc but the trade-off is the battery life is insanely long. It handles emails, Microsoft Office, web surfing, videos, music and everything else I need during the day or when travelling just fine and I have yet to run down the battery power all the way in a single day. It's not the best choice for your main/only laptop but if you're looking for something great to use more like a net book plus then you can't go wrong here.One thing about laptops that's always bothered me is that they're supposed to be designed for portability but with most laptops you're lucky to eek out 2 hours if you're using it a lot which is why you always see people with their laptops plugged in to wall outlets at Starbucks, airports, etc. It offends my sense of logic to what a device that's supposed to be wireless but still be a slave to a power cord. With my HP Envy X2 I always laugh now and feel sorry for people when I see them sit down with their laptop and immediately plug it in. The Envy X2 gives you true freedom from wires and you don't have to worry about running out of power...that ALONE is a reason to get this device.To summarize:Pros:1) Insanely great battery life2) See above3) Super cool form factor with detachable screen/tablet ability4) Touch screen capability which works with keyboard and tablet both (really nice for scrolling)Cons:1) Limited CPU power (again, which gives you longer battery life but be aware)2) Small hard drive: I would give this 5 stars if HP had included a slightly larger SSD hard drive. It's big enough to do the job but I would've preferred a 100/120 MB drive option and happily paid for it.3) Small RAM: I also wish HP had given this 4 GB of rather than 2 GB. Windows 8 eats up almost the full 2 gigs itself so 2 more gigs for apps would be great.Overall: truly amazing 2nd or "on the road" device. I find when I'm at home I keep this by the couch so I can grab it easily at night when I want to check something or work online.

Reviews.Title: Excellent machine for what it is, not what it's not
Reviews.Author: Keri Ellis
Reviews.Content: The title may seem confusing, but after extensive research on these atom based convertible laptops, I'm pretty sick of the "professional reviews" comparing this product to an ultrabook or i-core machine.What this machine IS NOT:1. An ultrabook or i-core machine2. The surface pro3. A gaming machine4. A video editing/audio editing machine5. A powerful laptop/desktop replacementWhat this machine is:1. A lightweight(ish) portable machine2. A tablet running a full version of windows with a laptop keyboard.3. A perfect computer for browsing the internet/watching youtube/online banking/other activities that 99.9% of people do on their computers.I've had this machine for a week and I'm liking it so far. It is perfect for what I need it for (web browsing and video watching). This machine runs media via XBMC with no problems after some adjustments(uncheck hardware acceleration in playback settings and plug in HDMI before starting it up and change sound setting to HDMI TV). I was able to hook up a portable hard drive and use that as the media feeder for XBMC and it had no trouble playing my media. It also runs Spotify just fine. If you need some more power download "Teamviewer" on your main computer and this computer and you can remote in from anywhere! Here are my pros and cons:Pros:- Included the keyboard dock- Two full sized USB ports- Full sized HDMI port- Full sized SD card reader.- Micro SD card slot on the tablet- Portable- Battery life (download "battery care" for accurate percentages/time left)Cons:- SOUND. This one is HUGE (and the main reason why I'm docking a star) The sound is horrible. Google "Digital Power Station" by Bongiovi Acoustics and download that program! It's free for 48 hours, but then it's $20. Totally worth the cost! I went from needing my sound to 80-100 (and still not be loud enough) to 25 being too loud!  I have mine set on "built in"/"movie" all the time (the headphones setting is lacking)- Somewhat heavy for a portable (I know I'm contradicting myself, but I wish it was a little big lighter.)- Tablet is a bit awkward to hold- With the tablet attached, it is top heavy and can tip backwards if the screen is back too far- No HDMI/USB on the tablet portion- Windows 8 is not that intuitive (download "Start 8" to get your start button back in desktop mode)- Not a lot of disk space (it's easy to go a bit download crazy since you can download anything, but you really have to treat it like a tablet in the disk space department).- SD cards are hard to get in/out of the slots without a tool of some sort.Overall, this computer is perfect for my needs and I'm sure many other people's. Think of it as a computer with a tablet form factor and battery life. I know the Intel Haswell chips are just on the horizon and they are promising i-core machines with 10+ hours of battery life. Unfortunately, we don't know how much those machines will cost or if they will have a lot of issues early on. I see myself getting a machine with those chips, but I'll probably wait a year or so until the price comes down/bugs are fixed. Until then, this machine is perfect for my daily needs. 4/5

Reviews.Title: Good laptop
Reviews.Author: Hiromi Kumamaru
Reviews.Content: I love this small, light, and detachable laptop, which is very useful as the portable as well as tablet computer.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Robert Guerra
Reviews.Content: works grey, processor is great, Hard drive is great and tablet can be used with any and all programs just like any other laptop.

Reviews.Title: Sweet
Reviews.Author: Oscar
Reviews.Content: A nice laptop/tablet at a great price. Had one just like it stolen and the price was great and it was like new.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last as long as it should have.
Reviews.Author: Jamie77
Reviews.Content: This WAS a great little laptop, but even though it has barely been used, one year later it is acting up.  Unfortunately, the warranty is only covers 1 year.

Reviews.Title: Whole new animal
Reviews.Author: Robert Fay
Reviews.Content: A convertible, loaded with Win8...Took a while to get comfortable with W8; still not sure I like all of its features, but the ability to uncouple the tablet makes this a useful addition to our computer family. Price was better than anywhere I'd seen them, and the shipping was almost immediate. Another satisfying experience thru Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I did like it at first..... but now, not so much (review update)
Reviews.Author: J. Moore
Reviews.Content: Ok... I am a bona-fide laptop person.  I'm not keen on Android, and prefer to see real software, folders etc. on my desktop screen.  BUT, I really wanted the cool portability of my husband's Asus transformer.  I think I got it with this HP Envy.  I've only had this a few weeks, but it is really fast and sleek. I'm liking Windows 8.  It seems easy to pick up the new tricks and formats.  I've been using this primarily in the laptop mode (clicked together), but will migrate more to tablet mode when traveling.Pros:  Really nice bright screen, and 11.6 is a good size.  Snappy processor.  Ability to switch from traditional desktop mode to Windows "tiles" and "charms" easily.  Fairly reasonable price.  Very customizable. Great battery life. Good keyboard.  Good USB & SD ports. I easily installed Office (from an external DVD/CD drive), AOL desktop, Adobe Reader, Firefox, etc.  Printing: Was able to e-print to HP laser located down the hall on the first attempt. Yeah!Cons:  Small hard drive.  With the above loaded (and no pics or music), I have approximately 23 gigs free.  Adequate at best, but will make do.  A bit "too slick"... the chrome is pretty and all, but in tablet mode, there is nothing to "grab" and it feels slippery in your hands (say, compared to my Kindle Fire).  I do NOT care for the audio, it seems quite tinny, even compared to the Kindle Fire's audio (but I was able to easily bluetooth to an external speaker).  Looked for an audio equalizer, but to no avail.  Weight: Separately the weight is good, but together it is a bit heavier than I would prefer (but not a deal breaker)Overall..... I'm pleased with my research and purchase so far, and would recommend this HP product.UPDATE FEB 12, 2014After several months of using this HP Envy, I can honestly say I would NOT recommend this product.  It is very glitchy. After dealing with several issues, I nearly sent it back, but foolishly thought that the upgrade to WIN 8.1 had solved the problems. Sometimes it did. Sometimes not. As mentioned in many reviews, the touchpad cuts out regularly, even after updating the driver.  Just ridiculous.I have too much time invested in this to start over with a new system. I will use this for traveling and nothing else.  Please do not make the same mistake. I am really done with Microsoft garbage...

Reviews.Title: Good size, nice keyboard.
Reviews.Author: D. Tal
Reviews.Content: Perfect size for portability, and the removable screen transforms it into a tablet.  Has a very nice keyboard, too.  So It seems to be the best of both worlds. It is still rather new, so I know I will learn many more things about it, including Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Changing my review from 4 stars to 1
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: Originally I said: "I like it. After 3 months I'm still learning things as far as the touch pad and windows 8 are concerned."However, I've now had it for about 5 months and my opinion is completely changed. It is unreliable. I NEED to use it as a recording device, however sometimes after recording something it will say that the file is corrupted and I cannot view it. WHAT??!?! Unacceptable. The camera is pretty low quality anyways, but still. Lately, when I record things and does actually work, the playback of the sound quality is horrible. It sounds like someone is scrunching up newspapers in the background.It takes too long to boot up. I want to be able to press the on button, swipe it open like I do my phone, and have it ready for use. Other tablets accomplish this however this one does not.A lot of other people have mentioned the mouse problem, so that's clearly a consistent issue. It's just unreliable as a tablet. It functions too slowly. Perhaps if it were just a laptop this would be less of a concern, but it's not.Also, as far as I can tell, there aren't any cases for it so you have to be very gentle with it.Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: 2-in-1 is pretty cool
Reviews.Author: kt_fitz14
Reviews.Content: Great Computer...Light with long battery life and the touch screen works great. I use it instead of printing off documents. Great for taking notes and highlighting on a pdf

Reviews.Title: Laptop hurts lap.
Reviews.Author: Carole Ann Camp
Reviews.Content: The screen is jumpy it flits around from here to there. The apps on the start-up screen go to places that are unfamiliar, ie google.There is a ridge where the top meets the bottom and when it is in one's lap for any amount of time, it begins to hurt.

Reviews.Title: the best hp
Reviews.Author: jorge
Reviews.Content: the laptop is a marvel super-lightweight and super durable structure, is one of the best laptops let alone when you make it super-versatile tablet is incredible comfortable with the ideal size

Reviews.Title: Good product at a good price
Reviews.Author: JayBird
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Powers up fast (SSD). Downloads apps and programs quickly. Size is great and it is very portable.  Keyboard has its own power for longer battery life.  Processor seems to be very quick and responsive.  Has a true operating system so runs REAL programs (we run office Pro + without any issues).  Works great with our Apple Air Wifi and even can print to our Kodak AIO wireless printer.  Has Micro SD memory slots too.  The Keyboard (that is actually included) is great to have.Cons:  Although we are not big gamers so we don't have this issue, some reviews say the video card might not be able to handle big time gaming (something you might want to check into if that is your thing. Also MS Windows requires security updates way too often nearly daily.I would buy this unit again.  For now, It seems to have the best features available at a really good price and is a very nice price.  You might want to check out all the new items coming out this fall for Christmas before purchasing one of these, especially that new kindle HDX (if they get a couple more options for Keyboards and accessories for it).

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Need!
Reviews.Author: Katie Falk
Reviews.Content: This laptop is perfect for me, a college student. I can use it to write papers, do research, and watch some Netflix when I need a break. The tablet is a good size, and the touch screen is spot on. Excellent product!

Reviews.Title: I like it so far
Reviews.Author: Claudio Muniz de Souza
Reviews.Content: I like the product in general. I've had it for a month and it's managed to deliver some nice improvements to my computing life but a few things still pose as a concern to me:1. The hard disk memory is limited (64GB)2. It's got small RAM memory.3. The sound seems lower than in my previous Sony laptopAs goods things I can mention:1. It's got great screen definition - beautiful view of photos and apps.2. It's light if used only as a tablet but seems a little heavy if used together with the keyboard.3. Battery life has been a plus s far - something like 9 or 10 hours for the tablet and the keyboard used together.4. The best feature for me: it can be used as a tablet or as a laptop!!Claudio Muniz de Souza - Campinas - Brazil

Reviews.Title: Perfect combination of tablet and laptop for just a good tablet price
Reviews.Author: B. Guillot "Papyguillot"
Reviews.Content: Excellent screen. Elegant design. Light weight. Long lasting two-battery power (up to 12 hours). Very fast at start up and power off.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Lois Coughtry
Reviews.Content: Its light weight and compact and as near as I can tell so far will fulfill my needs once I get used to "Windows 8"

Reviews.Title: disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Mango B
Reviews.Content: never worked properly, sent it in to HP for repair as Wifi died within 1st month.  Likely returning for refund

Reviews.Title: HP Envy
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Y.
Reviews.Content: Very good product , it`s running very well and is practical and versatile for use every day . Thank you very much .

Reviews.Title: It's ok but nothing more
Reviews.Author: Claudio Bessr
Reviews.Content: Works ok as a laptop, but as a tablet, needs improvement when working with stylus.Windows 8 and recovery system uses a lot of the 64gb.

Reviews.Title: It met my expectations in most ways.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Spencer
Reviews.Content: The HP .x2 11-g010nr has met my expectations in most ways. It is too bad HP website does not carry things like screen protectors for it. I am worried that I will damage the screen since it is a touch screen. It is a little touchy about getting the screen portion of the keyboard off and back on.  An explanation about which battery is #1 and #2 would have been nice. I figured it out by taking the screen off and seeing what it said for the amount of battery left versus when the screen was attached to the keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Getting used to Windows 8 is much easier with a touch screen
Reviews.Author: philip lemerise
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my purchase. It is light weight but seems to be made tough.I will get a 64 Gb SD card for extra storage.

Reviews.Title: Powerful, slick, comfortable - HP got it right
Reviews.Author: ForexTech
Reviews.Content: I am at a loss of words to describe this laptop/tablet. Its a winner and I would leave my PC for this device. Actually I think that's the better word for it - Device.1/ The keyboard base is also a powered docking session. When the battery on the tablet is low (when used separately), I just connect it back to the keyboard and it charges it, when travelling gives me more than 10hrs.2/ The screen is very comfortable. The 11" screen is the best, I can do business work like remote into a machine as well as personal.3/ With Windows 8 I can run all my regular apps like office, Visio, project4/ I thought 2GB of RAM would be small, but it works just fine. I have several apps open and there is no issue.5/ I got a USB hub, usb RJ45 adapter, usb headphone speaker, usb mouse, usb hdmi to VGA adapter, my online storage (no need but hard drive) and I have a full mobile workstation which I can use on any monitor as well as on a plane.6/ The keyboard is comfortable7/ The touch screen is very good.There is the occasional glitch but all in all its a great device.

Reviews.Title: HP envy
Reviews.Author: Rita Belobrov "Rita"
Reviews.Content: I Liked the option of having a tablet and a labtop, Like that it has windows 8 and easy to use

Reviews.Title: Beautiful looking hybrid
Reviews.Author: Gaurav Singhal
Reviews.Content: Brushed Aluminium looks great.Tablet/Keyboard link is pretty solid, which is very important me. Once docked, looks/feels exactly like a laptop vs some other hybrids.Battery lasts a long time.Volume on the slower side, hoping HP will fix this with a firmware update.

Reviews.Title: Nice hybrid from HP
Reviews.Author: David M Lando
Reviews.Content: Really like this hybrid from HP.  Really enjoy the solid metal case it maybe a bit heavier but it is solid.  Note - all the ports are on the keyboard not a big deal but did not realize it at first.  Also the link between the two is really rock solid.  I have had a few Windows 8 issues but nothing hardware related.  I am looking at a bigger one in the Envy line at home,

Reviews.Title: High Quality - Will change how you use PCs for the better
Reviews.Author: MNP "MP"
Reviews.Content: First off this is not an RT Windows product with all of its flaws.  Also, its not a 'tablet' this is a hybrid.  A Hybrid is not simply a tablet with a keyboard tossed onto it.  A Hybrid can be used as either a full PC with a full blown OS and your standard programs or you can pop off the top and have a thin, lite tablet that runs the tablet programs and still be able to use all your full power programs.  So you get the best of both worlds without paying for two devices!  The hinge seems to add a little weight to the device but its amazingly sturdy and props the computer up to a very comfortable position.  The dual batteries resulted it in staying in standby for day when I accidently left it on.  The touch screen is highly responsive.  It has FULL sized keys!  Typing is very easy and highly efficient which is critical to anyone who is into productivity.This PC runs Windows, Excel, PowerPoint etc..  It runs all of my productivity programs.  Unlike tablets that force you to use paired down half assed programs you get to run all the programs you are used to without learning how to use two programs and fighting with compatibility.  The simplicity of using the same set of applications is a joy.How this product will change how you use computers and take full advantage of cloud computing.  This thin, super portable PC with all its features cannot compare to my desktop but then no notebook runs as fast as my desktop.  So I use BOX.NET (no, I don't work for the company) or another company like windows drive, to have a folder on my desktop on both my 2x and my desktop.  As a part-time writer (there are almost no full time writers), I have all of my documents in a folder sitting on my desktop on both PCs.  When I close one document it is almost instantly updated on both computers.  Using the cloud I am completely productive on both of my systems.  Even if I had 10 computers to use if they all had that folder and my programs (Word, Excel..) I would be 100% productive.  So why bother to buy a tablet and a notebook when you can save a ton of money and have a very high-quality little machine that does both while using all your productivity programs all linked to the web?Oh, did I mention it even looks cool?

Reviews.Title: The perfect coffee-shop companion
Reviews.Author: G. Tudor "Cloud Guy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the X2 as a secondary laptop for travel that can act both as a work machine to edit presentations and excel as well as a full size tablet to read pdfs and documents on the go. I was also looking at the Macbook Air side-by-side for this purpose. But the envy's detachable screen sold me. Could not be happier with the purchase. Note that I am not comparing this machine to a regular Intel i5 processor notebook. To do so would be unfair as it's not designed to do this. It's a hybrid between a tablet and ultra-portable notebook--so I'll call it a "booklet"I have a kindle fire, but with new kindle app on the win 8 appstore I can now read my books on the Envy too. It is extremely snappy. This is the perfect coffee shop/airplane companion as it has all the horsepower and long battery life for typical MS Office apps and web browsing in a super lightweight fashion. Of course, the first thing I did was install Chrome as my browser.I haven't run out of battery life yet. The machine has two batteries - one in the keyboard and one in the screen, so this helps maximize life between charges. Keyboard and touchpad are very responsive. Only wish-list item would be a backlit keyboard.Pros:- Lightweight, ultra-compact, tablet+pc functionality, ultra-fast boot-up, great design, plenty of processing for workloads described above.Cons:- Low speaker volume - fine for at-home use but don't plan on hearing it in a coffee-shop like setting.- Win 8 - still getting used to it but can always switch to desktop mode which provides Win 7 like interface.- Intel Atom and max 2GB memory (though haven't run into any performance drawback yet). So this isn't your auto-cad or photoshop machine.Despite the cons I still give it 5 stars because it's perfect in the gap that it fills. Features of a tablet but versatility of a netbook.I let my 11 year old daughter play with it and she was begging for one. I guess that about sums it up. She was wanting an iPad previously but this has a much bigger screen and in her book is way cooler and has more wow factor. Great design job HP!

Reviews.Title: Keyboard problem resolved -- device almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Thomas C.
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 3/26/13:The keyboard problem that I outlined below has now been fixed through a recent BIOS update. Having spent around a week with the device, I can now say that it's almost perfect, and it far exceeds my expectations for a 1st generation device. I'll be brief about the biggest pros and the only cons.Major pros:-The battery life is phenomenal. I keep it plugged in overnight and I use it frequently throughout the day. I absolutely believe the advertised 12+ hours. I even have it set to sleep on battery power only after 60 minutes of inactivity, because it really just doesn't matter.-There are some cons involved with the Atom processor (see below), but it does a great job handling several large PDF's that I use frequently in my academic work. This Atom chip is a lot more capable than the ones on netbooks from 2-3 years ago.-Envy is a great name for the device. People are impressed when they notice it's a touchscreen, and their eyes bug out when you detach the tablet.Minor cons:-I had a previous unit that I returned after the keyboard problem, and unfortunately on my new one the dock connection seems somewhat less tight and secure--there's just a little wobble in the tablet relative to the dock, and I worry about long term stress on the electrical/data plug.-The Atom processor has exceeded my expectations in most respects, but it struggles with Word 2013 in large (200+ page) documents. This is odd to me, since it handles PDF's of the same size extremely well.=============ORIGINAL REVIEW:I absolutely wanted to love this device, but it suffers from a major keyboard defect.As indicated in at least one of the other reviews here, the device suffers from an incredibly frustrating problem with the keyboard. If you type with any kind of speed, then random characters are repeated, either extra spaces, or the letter that had been typed before a space. The pattern will look something like this:"The  quick brown fox xjumps over the lazy ydog."I've found out that this is a widely encountered problem, with several threads about it on the HP support forums, but nothing in the way of a substantive response from HP. I don't know that it's a problem on 100% of the devices, but a couple of people who went through 2 or 3 of the devices reported encountering it on all of them. If you don't type particularly fast, you might never notice the problem. I bought the device mainly as a secondary word processing device, so the keyboard error was an absolute deal breaker.In my case, HP technical support wouldn't acknowledge that this was a known problem, and they wanted me to ship the device to a repair center, less than 4 hours after unboxing it. After reading that several people on the HP forums have gone through the repair process and still received back a device with a faulty keyboard, I decided to return the device to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Tablet very nice, Keyboard has one major flaw. Unit Fails over all as a Laptop, OK as a Tablet.
Reviews.Author: gerald little
Reviews.Content: The Tablet and Keyboard in general meet all of my highest expectations. Windows 8 locks up occasionally but that is to be expected with a new operating system until the bugs get worked out. Updates are a daily thing (mostly windows defender) which is good. The Keyboard headphone jack audio volume however is disappointingly low at about half the Tablet headphone jack  volume and even when cranked up @ 100 % is barely audible through earphones at times. I've consulted the "Geek Squad" @ Best Buy on this and they are aware of the problem from H.P. w/ Beats Audio but have no solution except a possible hardware update of the keyboard in the future. All of the control panel volume settings have been optimized. I think that H.P. should have a Recall just like the Auto companies when there is a design defect such as this. I did my research on this before buying and didn't see anything out there on this issue and so I feel compelled to be the "whistle blower". I hope that this review works it's way back to somebody in charge who can make the necessary changes to keep another American company's image from being tarnished.I've also noticed that the battery drains excessively when mated together as a Laptop(down approx.5%/day)when shut down and unplugged from AC and will be in the charge mode for quite some time when you resume using it and plugged back into AC again. My windows 7 HP Pavilion on the other hand can be shut down for weeks and is usually @ 100% when it is powered back up again. This condition doesn't seem to hold true  when the Tablet is separated  from the Keyboard however and seems to hold a charge as expected.

Reviews.Title: Good Enough
Reviews.Author: Christian Okpada
Reviews.Content: If I good get a casing for the tablet part of this system it would score my 5 star. The many reviews against the ATOM it bear is over rated. It's a laptop for doing work on the go and not graphic design or animation desktop, so the speed is good for the price.The build is by far the key reason for buying this. I also didn't want a tablet just to play. So when this arrived I took it on a 3 weeks business trip, had MS Office Professional plus, Dreamweaver, Fireworks open all the through the journey just to test the speed and I can testify it's just ok. The challenge came when I had so many browser tabs open (became very slow).

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Jack Barfield
Reviews.Content: As soon as I received this product, I suspected something because the original package had been opened. I smelled a refurbished laptop. Once on, I had all kinds of problems eith my EMail. Secondly, my cursor would freeze up on me. After contacting HP, I still couldn't get the cursor working. It finally began to work, why, I don't know. I finally had enough and returned the item.

Reviews.Title: Good device as a ultra portably laptop with ocassional need as a tablet
Reviews.Author: MLi
Reviews.Content: I brought this convertible tablet over Samsung ATIV, and Asus Vivotab, and Acer's w510, and other i3/i5 core tablets.Why I picked an Atom processor device:Here is how I picked this device. I want a mobile device, so battery life is a key. The i3/i5/i7 tablets are somewhat short in battery life except Acer's Iconia W700. Even for Iconia, the i3/i5 processor is an overkill since I am not going to play Crysis nor any other graphic intensive game on a 11 inch screen. Honestly, Microsoft Surface tablet has feature I ever wanted in a mobile device, but the battery life killed the deal. If Microsoft can get Surface Pro to about 6-7 hour battery life, I will buy it in a heartbeat. There is a lot of potential for future surface pro models.  ARM processor  offers great battery life and comparable performance over Intel Atom, but having a real version of windows 8 instead of RT means I have a lot more choices over software. If in the future RT becomes more widely adopted, I will definitely consider switching.Here is why I picked Envy x2:Having a keyboard that can be easily integrated with the tablet is very important to me since I don't need this to be in tablet all the time. Having a keyboard would means I don't need to carry a second laptop with me if I do decide to work in Word or type anything more than few sentences.Advantage of Envy x2 over Asus vivotab ME400 is this one got a nice keyboard. The origami folded style stand with a detached keyboard seems like very troublesome to type anything serious unless you always have a flat surface like a table, and definitely not idea if you ever type on your lap. As far as Acer W510 goes, the tablet looks wonderful and it was very light weight, but the clamshell keyboard makes it look like a kid's toy. Acer's W700 seems like an idea candidate, but then again lack a good attachable keyboard is a problem. I really had a difficult time choosing between the Samsung ATIV, Lenovo Tab 2, and this. I didn't choose Lenovo due to the price difference and again lack of a good keyboard dock. ATIV has a stylus which I would like to have, but the exterior plastic just doesn't fit my taste.Review of Envy x2:The body is made of aluminum, which looks absolutely gorgeous. It has a nice keyboard dock with additional battery which is also very surprising good for typing. There is no problem at all for working in Microsoft Word. Battery life is very good, with mixed combination of Microsoft Word, Surfing the Web, watching Netflix, I get about 12 hours with the keyboard dock.Microsoft windows 8 works great on this device. The interface is fluid and responsive. Hardly noticed any lag if at all despite this machine runs on Atom processor.However, this device is not very easy on the hand when holding for a long period of time with just one hand grabbing by the edge. It is better with holding by using both hand or grab the center. It would easier to hold if there is a good case for it. So far, I haven't see any case on sell for this device at all.Pro:Good battery lifeNice finishing aluminum finishingKeyboard dock and can convert into a laptop.Surprising good speed (I was initially worried about the atom processor)Real Windows 8Con:No active stylus (I am hearing rumors Envy x2 supposes to come with one, but after going over multiple forum and website, that seems not to be true)Keyboard dock fits somewhat looselyHonestly, even at 1.5 lb, this tablet is hard to hold in one hand due to it's length.This device is not good for you if:You primarily need a tablet and don't need to type much. Get a lighter weight 10 inch tablet instead. Your hands and fingers will thank you. I would personally recommend Lenovo's Tab 2 (light weight, easy to hold, also stylus)If you need an active stylus, get Samsung ATIV if you need to type or Lenovo tab 2 if you not into typing.If you are planning to use this as your only computer.Conclusion:Good laptop/tablet for people who needs mobility. Overall very stylish looking device with nice metal finishing. Good productivities value with nice keyboard. Good for using as a laptop most of the time with occasional need as a tablet.

Reviews.Title: i dont like how the charging port allows bending inside wile the cord is pluged in..
Reviews.Author: Dr Patricia starr ashford
Reviews.Content: if you set the computer down and there happens to be your wallet there, the charging port will bend very east and one day im sure will break off.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: jill
Reviews.Content: I purchased this little laptop to use as a spare in the house when I didn't want to lug my larger laptop in my from office. I have all of my remote desktop links and other links on it and find it just what I was looking for.The battery life is very good-I often forget to shut it down and it still has a charge when I come back to it.I am not storing lots of data or photos on this device, just some personal things and a few photos before I move them to my external hard drive.I don't use the tablet feature much although it is pretty neat. We have several iDevices and use those as our tablets.I would have given this 5 stars, but Windows 8 is absolutely HORRIBLE and has taken a long time to learn. If this was a primary work computer I would have been completely crippled by this operating system. As it is, I have learned a little as I go with some frustration along the way.

Reviews.Title: 2nd one of these same units that died
Reviews.Author: Legacy Graphics Design "signwitch"
Reviews.Content: the first one we bought was dead-on-arrival.  it was returned and a 2nd one purchased.  it lived less than a full month and also died.  HP won't get a 3rd chance....

Reviews.Title: Touchscreen issues beware
Reviews.Author: Stephen A.
Reviews.Content: This tablet has grounding issues.  Touch does not work in the center of the screen if taken out of the dock, or placed on a tablet stand.  If you aren't touching the metal somewhere with your other hand, touch is erratic.  My model also came with a defect in the screen bezel lining.  The rubber was receded along half of one side and exposed the glass on that edge.  This area collected dust from my cleaning cloth rather quickly too.  Other than this, the tablet wasn't bad for what it was designed to do.  But, I ended up returning it because of the issues and ordered a Yoga 13 (which is phenomenal).

Reviews.Title: Hp review
Reviews.Author: No no
Reviews.Content: I really like this product, since the screen is detachable so it can be used as a notebook .Except that its didn't come with a product key number , its lip not straight when placed on a flat surface like a table , I don't know if its supposed to be wiggle when connected to the keyboard.

Reviews.Title: great device
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M Chong
Reviews.Content: I work for myself as a sole prop. and rely on Outlook and MS Office. This is a great device that allows me to stay connected with all my files via SkyDrive use Office and Outlook but still release it from the keyboard to have a light weight tablet. I have two kids and downloaded a few movies and games for them for a recent trip. It was nice just bringing this device. My wife has an iPad, which we also brought on the trip- but that is purely entertainment for the  kids with the games and videos.

Reviews.Title: User
Reviews.Author: Sarah Blake Cates
Reviews.Content: touch feature is unreliable. There is no$ enough processing power to it. I am very disappointed frustrated but dont want to pay restocking etc.;(....

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This was my first netbook type laptop. I love it. It does occasionally lock up if you have too many programs running. Other than that it is light weight, super portable, and has great battery life. It also charges the screen when it is connected to the keyboard. This allows you to keep the screen at a higher charge level than the keyboard so you can utilize the tablet function more. I use it for school and web browsing mostly and it certainly works well for this.

Reviews.Title: The Envy & Win 8
Reviews.Author: H. Yates "Hay"
Reviews.Content: Update: Major problem. Windows 8 REQUIRES internet connection and this Envy does NOT connect unless you are within 5 feet of a hotspot. This gets really scary when you canNOT login! Error reads "use the last login used on this account"? So 1) hours back I was in and out gmail accounts, shopping accounts and this machine is asking me to remember the LAST one I used?? or 2) find a connection so I CAN LOGIN.Major problem 2: I have NOTHING stored on this machine. Zero. I have 17.6 GB free out of 46.3. The only programs I have installed are firewall, antivirus, and Windows office (for work). So MAKE SURE before you leave home you are logged into your user account and be prepared to buy a few SDHC Flash Memory Cards for all your work, and don't depend on picking up the coffee shop wifi.Major problem 3: Agree sound card so cheap you cannot play music on this machine. Unless you love the sound of 1960 scratched mono vinyl records.*****Major problem 4: Still hauling the AC adapter!! HP, where can I buy a back up????? No I am NOT paying $$$80 for one. What a scam!!So no music, no video, no memory, no RAM, no app games, no wifi, NO ADAPTER, and to get Kindle to PC to work you need to be a good Tech (luckily I am and found an Opensource program to read my books). Good cam. Think what you need before you buy and know your tech level!Pro: Still is working after 4 months cycling to work.*************************************************************Envy: Love the keyboard. Compact but sensitive and comfortable.Amazing display.WARNING! The tablet weighs more than the keyboard! Do not place on the edge where a slight tap will topple it over. No, this did not happen to me. I tested this as soon as I placed it on the table. With 2 cats this was an important test.I'll update this after a few months use (Bought in March 2013 so check back this summer). My commute to work consists of 30m by bicycle most days (3m on rough roads), some Metro/trains. The cycle commute already killed one 16" laptop (Toshiba). I'm hoping the Tablets are tougher.Windows 8:WARNING! You will NOT get 64G memory -- not even close! 11G is swallowed on Drive D for re-installation and another 20G is eaten by Win 8. That leaves you with about 24G!!WARNING! If you are not use to Cloud computing you need to take the time to learn! M$ created Win 8 to >seamlessly< move between the Cloud and your hard-drive. The Cloud is not 100% safe and if your document/media is on the Cloud you cannot reach it unless you are connected to the internet. Basically, if you use an App it is on the Cloud.No Hibernate, just Sleep.APPS do NOT uninstall! The link is just removed from sight. .5G is not an issue when you have terabytes of memory but in Tablets this is important.Kindle:I bought this so I would only have to carry 1 device for work and commute entertainment (ie Kindle). Here is what I learned.Kindle APP: Fail. After an hour I could only open one book at a time, I love my digital library the same as my bookshelves. I also like to read more than one book at a time. Also during my tests I would >think< I sent the book to my hard-drive but when turning off wifi (airport mode) found out the book was on some mysterious Cloud and not accessible. Not an experience I want on a bus! --- So I am using the Kindle to PC download. Which means you have to download all of your books, one at a time, and create your 'Collection' again. But at least I KNOW they are on my Tablet. >>> Update: good luck with Kindle to PC. Found an Open Source to read my books.  >>>>note about Kindle books: To authors/artist NO I do NOT agree that when I pay for digital content (books, music, photos...) I am only RENTING! That is so WRONG! Sadly Amazon is on the line of this. Ki$$ing up to the publishers and what consumers will support. So at anytime an author can decide to take off the books and swoop, those books are no longer in your library AND no refund because you were just 'renting' the digital materials. If you believe what you buy is yours you need to back up your digital content! NEVER TRUST THE CLOUD!

Reviews.Title: Decent Laptop/Hybrid for Recreational Use
Reviews.Author: C. Davis
Reviews.Content: The Envy X2 is not a high performance machine, but is a decent machine for checking email, social media, web browsing, and moderate processing. It is not ideal for multi-tasking with numerous applications open. I purchased it because I was not looking for a high performance machine, but I wanted a tablet with a keyboard option with a full OS that wasn't going to cost $1,000+. The Envy x2 has met those requirements, with a few quirks:1. Unintentional double-spacing. As others have reported, there is an issue with inserting extra spaces when typing. I only notice it when I am typing at higher speeds, but I tested it using MS Word and in a full paragraph it flagged several extra spaces between words. Not a deal breaker for me, but if you need that accuracy this machine will cause you headaches. However, I have not yet noticed the extra characters being inserted (maybe that was fixed with one of the updates).2. Camera quality. Although it includes an 8MP rear camera and a "HD" front facing webcam, the quality of the pictures it takes is awful. I never intended to use it for taking pictures, but the pictures I took using the rear camera were grainy and blurry. I tried adjusting the settings, but it didn't help. The front facing webcam was what you would expect from a low quality webcam, definitely not "HD". Edit: I am going to check with tech support on this because I found reviews that included pictures they took with both cameras and their images look pretty good... nothing like what I'm getting.3. Wi-fi connection. When I first logon, the wi-fi always seems to establish a "limited" connection. I have to disconnect and re-connect to resolve. After that, it works ok until I shut down and sign back in again.4. Speakers. The Beats audio dual speakers are a joke. If you want any decent sound out of it, you will need a bluetooth speaker or headphones.I purchased mine from Staples for $525+tax so at that price I can live with the above inconveniences. The alternative was the MS Surface Pro, but to me it isn't worth the extra $600+.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight, Versatile
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Wright "Ron"
Reviews.Content: The Envy x2 is lightweight, versatile, has long battery life and a great touchscreen! It can be used as a notebook or a tablet. Great for travelling.

Reviews.Title: My Envy X2
Reviews.Author: Harry Mclean
Reviews.Content: The product is exceptional and fully exceeds my expectations which are high.  The garbage that I read in reviews about the keyboard and display do not hold water with me.  I would recommend this table/laptop to anyone whether a novice or expert.  Great job HP!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Machine - Troubling Network Card
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Jehle
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviews say, this is a beautiful machine.  It makes compromises between speed and battery life, but overall I think the HP engineers have handled that very well. A laptop/tablet is a wonderful thing.However, every time I shut the machine down, the network connection is lost on turning it back on.  HP tech support has been great and very responsive, but all to no avail.  I turned the original back in for a replacement, and it has the same problems.  It is not that big of a deal, as the network troubleshooter fixes it every time by resetting the network card, but somewhat of a pain.As others have said, the Wi-Fi is weak, but that seems to be a trade off over battery life.

Reviews.Title: Great Concept
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I bought the Envyx2 as a trial for the new windows 8 hybrid, and for what it has I say its a great product, but doesn't replace the laptop. It's great for school viewing or work presentations, and the battery life makes it worth it.

Reviews.Title: Thanks
Reviews.Author: Khayal Sadikhov
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the laptop. It's really a great item. Perfect deal and great price. Works very good - I'm satisfied

Reviews.Title: Audio Problems
Reviews.Author: Absolute Stunna
Reviews.Content: Am I the only one have audio issues with this laptop. I have updated this laptop more than 20 times (not exaggerating) and unfortunately the last update has made the audio correction even worse.

Reviews.Title: Completely nonintuitive
Reviews.Author: scfmd
Reviews.Content: the keyboard does not come up automatically when you hit a test field necessitating a search and swipe every time.  really slows things down.hitting a button in a program takes a long time to do anything, so the machine is much slower than the original HP slate (which I loved).I understand Windows 8 is just out of beta, but the hardware is incapable of handling it as is.as a laptop, it works fine, but there are lots of better laptops out there for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: Review of Hp Envy
Reviews.Author: Kathy Meyer
Reviews.Content: Should have a Ethernet hook up! Also if it is detachable then it should come with a stylist. This is not the best thing college!

Reviews.Title: Really nice!
Reviews.Author: Arda Arslan
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this laptop is not for business  but it is good for students. Most people like that it turns into a tablet which I do like but don't use much.

Reviews.Title: New tablet
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: I love it. Laptop or  tablet.  works great.  Have my mouse attached for regular use.  Then can use as tablet for reading and on the go.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Dianne D Sparrow "Dianne D Sparrow"
Reviews.Content: Best present I have bought for myself in years! It's light, small, and packed with great options!  Would not take twice the $ for it.

Reviews.Title: hola quisiera saber si me pueden ayudar
Reviews.Author: Andres
Reviews.Content: hola quisiera saber si me pueden ayudar por que  se me perdió la clave de mi keygen para poder obtener el microssof office por q me pide  una clave  y no la tengo disculpen las molestias el producto esta excelente solo me falto esa clave no mas por favor ayúdenme

Reviews.Title: not a  5star????
Reviews.Author: christopher waters
Reviews.Content: Nope but only due to fact that I am learning windows 8 and having a great time. The functionality of the HP envy is great. but for those who don't know windows 8 I would advise to learn some of the basics first. I know once I accomplish the windows 8 then I can rate this product as 5 stars

Reviews.Title: still getting use to it
Reviews.Author: Margaret Cannon
Reviews.Content: so far so good. Haven't experienced any problems so far. Want to give it move time before I give it 5 stars,

Reviews.Title: HP Envy x2
Reviews.Content: HP did a great job with the design and feel on this laptop. But I could not deal with the Windows 8. The OS was confusing because there were times that it behaved like a tablet and other times with I was a laptop. If there was a way to get Apples OS on this machine it would be AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: Horrendous Device
Reviews.Content: Update / May 19, 2014 - My Envy x2 has been back to HP for repairs twice now and they are unable to fix the problem. I now have a 650 dollar paperweight. For anyone considering buying one of these, I would suggest you call HP Customer Service first and just listen to their voice prompt system. They have a voice prompt for people experiencing 'power on' issues. That's what I would call a 'hint'.------------------------------------------I've had my Envy x2 for close to a year now but it is going in a box today and will be returned. For anyone doing research prior to buying an Envy x2, google `Envy x2 won't turn on' .... and then look for another brand of tablet. I have 2 other HP computers and really like HP products and I love the x2 when I am able to get it to turn on, but I am finally done dealing with this horrendous device.When I first bought this x2 I noticed there were times it would not power up on the first attempt. The problem got worse but it appeared to me that is was more a BIOS or resource conflict issue and after seeing other people were having the same issue, I had hoped HP would resolve this and offer a fix through an update. I did periodically conduct my own searches for BIOS or other updates, performed the updates, but the problem remained.About 2 weeks ago I had the x2 take more than 100 attempts to turn on and that was the last straw for me. I called HP and after being transferred 7 times, I finally got someone who walked me through a BIOS update and the device appeared to be working properly. For 1 week, it powered up every time on the first attempt. Then I noticed there were Windows updates scheduled to be installed, which I allowed to happen. Immediately after they installed, I made 130 attempts to turn the x2 on, to no avail. HP recommends you press and hold the power button for at least 4 seconds. The 130 attempts took close to 7 minutes, but it would not turn on.This morning I tried again and the device powered up on the 7th attempt. I am wiping the hard drive right now and it will be IN THE BOX once complete and going back to someone. I would prefer to get my money back but am not sure that will happen as I've had the device for close to 1 year.I love the x2 once I get it to power up but it is going back because I am not going to spend 6 or 7 minutes trying to turn something on. I've owned 20 to 25 computers in my life and this is the absolute worst computing device I have ever owned.There appears to be some x2 owners who do not experience this issue but it also appears HP cannot figure why this is happening to far too many users. You can roll the dice and hope you get a good one, but I know if I had to do it all over again, I would not buy an x2.

Reviews.Title: Too challenging
Reviews.Author: Lightning Rod "TM"
Reviews.Content: I've had a tablet computer and other touch tablets and this one doesn't cut it.  It doesn't respond to touches like it should and the locking mechanism isn't secure enough.I'd look at getting a laptop OR a tablet and leave this one one the shelf.As you can tell others don't like this machine either.  Others don't like my review.  I really wish Amazon made reviewers give reasons why, put input, etc... when putting a review rather than simply liking or disliking.
